com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.configuration

Class HAConfigurationValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.configuration.HAConfigurationValidator

  • public final class HAConfigurationValidator
extends Object
    An instance of this class is used to validate HA-specific configuration components when loading or reloading the application's configuration.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HAConfigurationValidator(ConfigurationObjectRegistry configurationRegistry)
      Constructor.

        Parameters:
        configurationRegistry - the configuration registry in which the application's configuration has been loaded

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public void validate(List<String> errors)
        Validates HA-specific configuration:
        • Inspects cluster site write quorum specifications:
          • Validates that each individual quorum is a positive integer.
          • Validates quorum values as follows:
            • For a given cluster site, the write quorum at local site value must be strictly less than the total number of cluster nodes at that site.
            • For a given cluster site, the write quorum at remote sites value must be less than or equal to the total number of cluster nodes at other sites.
            • For a given cluster site, the write quorum at all sites value must be strictly less than the total number of cluster nodes in the cluster.
            • For a given cluster site, the sum of the three write quorum values must be strictly less than the total number of cluster nodes in the cluster.
        • Inspects cluster node configurations:
          • Validates that cluster node IDs are unique.
          • Validates that port numbers are strictly positive.
          • Validates that each combination of host and port is unique.
        • Checks that the local cluster node's ID read from the command line corresponds to one of the cluster nodes declared in the configuration.
        • Checks that the following attribute values are strictly positive integers:
          • com.camerontec.catalys.server.configuration.model.HighAvailabilityClusterConfiguration.CfgField#GROUP_PUBLISH_PERIOD
          • com.camerontec.catalys.server.configuration.model.HighAvailabilityClusterConfiguration.CfgField#PRIMARY_VALIDITY_CHECKS_TIMEOUT
          • com.camerontec.catalys.server.configuration.model.HighAvailabilityClusterConfiguration.CfgField#BECOMING_PRIMARY_ACTIONS_TIMEOUT
          • com.camerontec.catalys.server.configuration.model.HighAvailabilityClusterConfiguration.CfgField#RELINQUISHING_PRIMARY_ACTIONS_TIMEOUT
          • com.camerontec.catalys.server.configuration.model.HighAvailabilityClusterConfiguration.CfgField#REPLICATION_TIMEOUT
        • Checks that the value of the com.camerontec.catalys.server.configuration.model.HighAvailabilityClusterConfiguration.CfgField#MAX_CLUSTER_MESSAGE_SIZE attribute is sensible.
        • Checks that the value of attribute com.camerontec.catalys.server.configuration.model.HighAvailabilityClusterConfiguration.CfgField#GROUP_AGE_THRESHOLD is greater than 3
        • For each ping configuration encountered, validates that the timeout associated with each destination is a strictly positive integer.
        • For each generic primary validity check encountered:
          • Validates that the specified class name corresponds to a sub-type of IGenericPrimaryValidityCheck that can be instantiated.
          • Checks that associated properties, if any, do not contain any duplicates.
        • For each generic becoming-primary action encountered:
          • Validates that the specified class name corresponds to a sub-type of IGenericBecomingPrimaryAction that can be instantiated.
          • Checks that associated properties, if any, do not contain any duplicates.
        • For each generic relinquishing-primary action encountered:
          • Validates that the specified class name corresponds to a sub-type of IGenericRelinquishingPrimaryAction that can be instantiated.
          • Checks that associated properties, if any, do not contain any duplicates.
        Parameters:
        errors - the list where each error encountered during validation should accumulated. This allows for the detection of more than one error at a time
